qBittorrent.description:
qBittorrent client with a WebUI.

Note: Ensure that the WebUI Port is the same as the WEBUI_PORT to avoid issues with the Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection that qBittorrent has implemented.

The initial WebUI user is admin and initial password is adminadmin. This can then be adjusted in the Settings Menu later.

For a more detailed description, check here WebUI Port and CSRF.

Based on a custom docker image: https://hub.docker.com/r/linuxserver/qbittorrent, available for amd64 and arm64 architecture.

/config.description: Configuration for qBittorrent. Ensure the write permissions correspond to the UID/GID entered later for this Rockon.
/config.label: Configuration for qBittorrent

/downloads.description: Primary share used for downloads. You can add more after the initial install of this Rockon. Ensure the write permissions correspond to the UID/GID entered later for this Rockon.
/downloads.label: Data storage

8080.description: qBittorrent WebUI port. Ensure that the WebUI Port is the same as the WEBUI_PORT to avoid issues with the Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection that qBittorrent has implemented.
8080.label: External WebUI port

WEBUI_PORT.description: Explicitly enter the same port number maintained above for the WebUI port (e.g., 8080 is usually the suggested default for the WebUI port if it is not used in any other Rockon). See the description of WebUI setting for more details.
WEBUI_PORT.label: WEBUI_PORT

PUID.description: Enter a valid UID of an existing user with permissions to the download and configuration shares used for qBittorrent.
PUID.label: UID

PGID.description: Enter a valid GID of an existing user with permissions to the download and configuration shares used for qBittorrent.
PGID.label: GID
